comment.author: 45198415@N07
comment._content: Cool picture. I'd likwacko know the story of why the fork is backwards.

comment.author: 23666168@N04
comment._content: The fork was in this position for motor-pacing so the rider could be closer to the car or motor bike that was providing a slipstream to ride in. The car or motor bike would have had a roller device attached in case the cyclist's front wheel came too near and touched it.
